Issues.Title: Update THIRD-PARTY-NOTICES.TXT
Issues.Body: Added license notice for Zlib and Json.NET
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Update THIRD-PARTY-NOTICES.TXT" (#876)

Issues.Title: An ActiveX control hosted in a WindowsFormsHost is redrawn incorrectly after resizing the host window.
Issues.Body: * .NET Core Version: (e.g. 3.0 Preview15-27626-15) * Windows version: (1809(OS Build 17763.503) * Does the bug reproduce also in WPF for .NET Framework 4.8?: No in 4.7.2 ActiveX control is redrawn shifted to the left and up such that its left and top edge are clipped when the control has focus and the window is resized. The control continues to shift left and up as the above steps are repeated. I found this issue while attempting to port our code to Core3. We have a highly customized ActiveX graphing control that we moved from MFC to WPF a couple of years ago. We are now moving to Core 3 and noticed a problem with the control. When a user clicks on the graph it is redrawn shifted to the left and up such that its left and top edge are clipped. We then tested several other ActiveX components and found similar behavior although resizing the host window was required to reproduce the shifted drawing. Just to rule out our ActiveX controls we built a sample button from GetHub\VCSamples-master\VC2008Samples\MFC\controls\button and observed the same behavior although it throws a pair of unrelated exceptions when the window loses focus. Expected Behavior: Building the same application but using .Net 4.7.2 does not display the drawing defect although the exceptions are thrown by the sample button. The control simply changes size as the window changes size. Minimal Repro: Using Visual Studio 2019 Preview Version 16.1.0 Preview 3.0 create a new WPF application using .NET Core 3. Add to the MainWindow.xaml a Loaded event and a 3x3 grid containing a WindowsFormsHost in row 1 column 1. Set the background property of the WindowsFormsHost to yellow and the grid background to azure or any contrasting color. To Dependencies add a registered ActiveX component wrapped by aximp.exe to the Assemblies and add NuGet Microsoft.NETCore.App.Host.win-x86 (3.0.0-preview5-27626-15). In MainWindow.xaml.cs add the Window_Loaded event and within the function new the button and assign it to WindowsFormsHost.Child. Alternatively the two projects at https://1drv.ms/f/s!AB8PEB5wHC4Jeg contain the button control and the WPF application. After building the button control register it using regsvr32. Then create the import wrapper by running aximp.exe. In my case C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft SDKs\Windows\v10.0A\bin\NETFX 4.7.2 Tools>aximp.exe button.ocx /out: C:\Download\MS MFC Samples\GetHub\VCSamples-master\VC2008Samples\MFC\controls\button\Debug\AxInterop.button.dll Next build the WPF application and ensure the following dependencies: Under Assemblies AxInterop.button NuGet Microsoft.NETCore.App.Host.win-x86 (3.0.0-preview5-27626-15) 1. Run the app 2. click the button 3. Resize the window by dragging lower right corner 4. button is redrawn with boarder on all sides 5. Minimize the window 6. Restore the window. Button is now drawn in the upper left corner of the WindowsFormsHost 7. Repeat steps 2-4, button is redrawn with small boarder at top-left, larger boarder bottom-right. 8. Repeat steps 5-6, button is redrawn in upper left corner with large boarder at bottom-right. 9. As these steps are repeated the button's upper left corner is increasingly clipped.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "An ActiveX control hosted in a WindowsFormsHost is redrawn incorrectly after resizing the host window." (#878)

Issues.Title: WPF Toolkit and Futures
Issues.Body:
WPF Toolkit and Futures (and a few other goodies) located at https://archive.codeplex.com/?p=wpf were the first parts of wpf to be open-sourced AFAIK.

Are there plans to merge those back in this repository in any form?

Issues.Title: ILDASM shows popups during build
Issues.Body:
`ILDASM` shows popups during builds. 

During local/dev builds, the popup window is prone to accidental dismissal and consequent build failure. 

Suppress UI using `/quiet`
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "ILDASM shows popups during build" (#875)

Issues.Title: Ensure that implicit references for .NET Framework projects are appropriate when targeting net3x and net40
Issues.Body:
Fixes #255

Traditionally, Visual Studio has supplied these references for .NET Framework based WPF Projects: 
    
 - .NET 3.x:   PresentationCore, PresentationFramework, WindowsBase 
 - .NET 4.x:   PresentationCore, PresentationFramework, WindowsBase, System.Xaml 


    `Microsoft.NET.WindowsDesktop.SDK` will supply the following references to .NET Framework based 
    WPF Projects: 
    
    - .NET 3.x:
       - PresentationCore, PresentationFramework, WindowsBase 
    
    - .NET 4.0:   
       - PresentationCore, PresentationFramework, WindowsBase, System.Xaml, 
       - UIAutomationClient, UIAutomationClientSideProviders, UIAutomationProvider, UIAutomationTypes
                
    - .NET 4.5+:  
       - PresentationCore, PresentationFramework, WindowsBase, System.Xaml, 
        - UIAutomationClient, UIAutomationClientSideProviders, UIAutomationProvider, UIAutomationTypes
         - System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Ensure that implicit references for .NET Framework projects are appropriate when targeting net3x and net40" (#881)

Issues.Title: WIP - Enable APICompat in WPF Builds
Issues.Body:
Fixes #724 

See: https://github.com/rladuca/ApiCompatNotes/blob/master/ApiCompat%20Notes.txt

This sets up and enables API Compat against .NET 4.8 reference assemblies and also ensures compat between hand-crafted ref assemblies and their lib counterparts.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "WIP - Enable APICompat in WPF Builds" (#880)

Issues.Title: HierarchicalDataTemplate not working due to missing WPF extension assemblies from Preview 6 Build
Issues.Body:
* .NET Core Version: Preview6
* Windows version: Win10
* Does the bug reproduce also in WPF for .NET Framework 4.8?: No

 <!-- Read https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/blob/master/Documentation/issue-guide.md -->
 
 **Problem description:**
 HierarchicalDataTemplate appears to not be working correctly, using the XAML below you should see a window with a hierarchical view, but instead only a textblock with "System.Xml.XmlElement". This is a regression from Preview5

 **Actual behavior:** <!-- callstack for crashes / exceptions -->
 A textblock with "System.Xml.XmlElement"

 **Expected behavior:**
 A hierarchical view

 **Minimal repro:**
 
```xaml
<Window x:Class="TreeViewRegression.MainWindow"
        xmlns="http://schemas.microsoft.com/winfx/2006/xaml/presentation"
        xmlns:x="http://schemas.microsoft.com/winfx/2006/xaml"
        xmlns:d="http://schemas.microsoft.com/expression/blend/2008"
        xmlns:mc="http://schemas.openxmlformats.org/markup-compatibility/2006"
        xmlns:local="clr-namespace:TreeViewRegression"
        mc:Ignorable="d"
        Title="MainWindow" Height="450" Width="800">

    <Grid Background="{DynamicResource {x:Static SystemColors.ControlBrushKey}}">
        <Grid.Resources>
            <XmlDataProvider x:Key="FoodDataSource" XPath="FoodGroups">
                <x:XData>
                    <FoodGroups xmlns="">
                        <FoodItem Name="Food">
                            <FoodItem Name="Fruit">
                                <FoodItem Name="Apple" />
                                <FoodItem Name="Citrus">
                                    <FoodItem Name="Orange" />
                                    <FoodItem Name="Lemon" />
                                </FoodItem>
                            </FoodItem>
                            <FoodItem Name="Bread">
                                <FoodItem Name="White" />
                                <FoodItem Name="Wheat" />
                            </FoodItem>
                            <FoodItem Name="Dairy">
                                <FoodItem Name="Cheese" />
                                <FoodItem Name="Milk" />
                            </FoodItem>
                            <FoodItem Name="Vegetable">
                                <FoodItem Name="Broccoli" />
                                <FoodItem Name="Lettuce" />
                            </FoodItem>
                            <FoodItem Name="Meat">
                                <FoodItem Name="Beef" />
                                <FoodItem Name="Chicken" />
                            </FoodItem>
                        </FoodItem>
                    </FoodGroups>
                </x:XData>
            </XmlDataProvider>

            <HierarchicalDataTemplate DataType="FoodItem" ItemsSource="{Binding XPath=FoodItem}">
                <TextBlock Text="{Binding XPath=@Name}" />
            </HierarchicalDataTemplate>

        </Grid.Resources>


        <TreeView  Name="HierarchicalDB" ItemsSource="{Binding Source={StaticResource FoodDataSource}, XPath=FoodItem}" Margin="5" />
    </Grid>

</Window>

}
```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "HierarchicalDataTemplate not working due to missing WPF extension assemblies from Preview 6 Build" (#861)

Issues.Title: System.Printing Support
Issues.Body:
This was created based on a discussion from https://github.com/dotnet/corefx/issues/37978

> I was trying to port an API to .NET Core that uses System.Printing PrintServer and related.  I came across this [doc](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/api/system.printing.printserver?view=netcore-3.0) and have the impression System.Printing is supported.

I was informed ([from issue link above](https://github.com/dotnet/corefx/issues/37978#issuecomment-498908611)) this is part of WPF and can be use by creating a `dotnet new wpf`.  However, I would like to use as a Class Library even if it must use the Win Compatibility package and Windows only.

We have many APIs to create/print labels that call the System.Printing APIs.  It would be nice to continue the same approach using WPF with .NET Core v3 and beyond.

Thanks in advance for any help.  It will be appreciated.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "System.Printing Support" (#871)

Issues.Title: Make SaveFileDialog support NOTESTFILECREATE.
Issues.Body:
Needs to stop SaveFileDialog from creating an empty file.

The problem for us is that we have configured the file system security so that a file can be created and filled with data, but once it has been closed, it may not be modified or deleted (by a regular user). When our application tries to use file name returned by the SaveFileDialog, that file already exists and we get the following error when we try to fill it with data: “You don’t have permission to modify files in this network location.”
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Make SaveFileDialog support NOTESTFILECREATE." (#870)

Issues.Title: Support `Microsoft.NetCore.App.Wpf` and `Microsoft.NetCore.App.WinForms` profiles in `Microsoft.NET.Sdk.WidnowsDesktop`
Issues.Body:
Fixes #866 

Related: [WindowsDesktop reference assembly split](https://github.com/dotnet/cli/issues/10536)

| UseWPF  | UseWindowsForms  | FrameworkReference |
| --- | --- | --- |
| False | False  | *Error* (Will be addressed in #867)  |
| True  | False   | `Microsoft.WindowsDesktop.App.WPF` |
| False | True   | `Microsoft.WindowsDesktop.App.WindowsForms`   |
| True | True    | `Microsoft.WindowsDesktop.App` |
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Support `Microsoft.NetCore.App.Wpf` and `Microsoft.NetCore.App.WinForms` profiles in `Microsoft.NET.Sdk.WidnowsDesktop` " (#868)

Issues.Title: Support Microsoft.NetCore.App.Wpf and Microsoft.NetCore.App.WinForms profiles in Microsoft.NET.Sdk.WidnowsDesktop

Support `Microsoft.NetCore.App.Wpf` and `Microsoft.NetCore.App.WinForms` profiles in `Microsoft.NET.Sdk.WidnowsDesktop` when `UseWpf` and/or `UseWindowsForms` is `true`

https://github.com/dotnet/sdk/pull/3259
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Support Microsoft.NetCore.App.Wpf and Microsoft.NetCore.App.WinForms profiles in Microsoft.NET.Sdk.WidnowsDesktop" (#866)

Issues.Title: Crash in DataGridItemAutomationPeer
Issues.Body:
VS 2017 and 2019 crash when
a. Automation is enabled (e.g. Narrator or Inspect are running)
b. User clicks on the Text Editor\C#\Code Style\Naming page in Tools\Options
(also other similar pages)

This is a regression in 4.8.  The bad pages contain a DataGrid whose cells contain a ComboBox, and whose virtualizing mode is Recycling

Fixes #860
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Crash in DataGridItemAutomationPeer" (#862)

Issues.Title: Crash in VS opening 'Naming'
Issues.Body: Port from .Net 4.8 bug.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Crash in VS opening 'Naming'" (#860)

Issues.Title: Show error when neither UseWpf nor UseWindowsForms is set to true
Issues.Body: When neither `UseWpf` nor `UseWindowsForms` is set to `true`, `Microsoft.NET.Sdk.WindowsDesktop` should show a (suppressible) error
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Show error when neither UseWpf nor UseWindowsForms is set to true" (#867)

Issues.Title: Need to embed wpf loose theme files into their theme assemblies
Issues.Body:
<!-- Read https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/blob/master/Documentation/issue-guide.md -->

For the XAML tooling experience for WPF NetCore needs to be decoupled from .Net Framework.  The themes loose file will need to be embeded into their theme assemblies so that XAML Designer can extract theme when creating a copy of a template.  

Below is the table of the loose file to be included into their respective theme assemblies

XAML | Assembly
-- | --
aero.normalcolor.xaml | PresentationFramework.Aero.dll
aero2.normalcolor.xaml | PresentationFramework.Aero2.dll
aerolite.normalcolor.xaml | PresentationFramework.AeroLite.dll
classic.xaml | PresentationFramework.Classic.dll
luna.homestead.xaml | PresentationFramework.Luna.dll
luna.metallic.xaml
luna.normalcolor.xaml
royale.normalcolor.xaml | PresentationFramework.Royale.dll
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Need to embed wpf loose theme files into their theme assemblies" (#865)
